name: Franco Seiler
bio: Franco Seiler is a Full Stack Developer from Córdoba, Argentina. He has over 3 years of experience building scalable web applications with React, Node.js, TypeScript and modern tools. He's passionate about clean code, performance, user experience and integrating AI into real-world products.
availability: Open to remote or hybrid roles in Europe or globally
experience: 3+ years developing modern and scalable web applications
achievements: Optimized web app response times by 20%
Increased user retention by 15% with SPA implementation
Improved page load times by 30% using React and performance tweaks

workExperience.title: Full Stack Developer
description: Built full-stack applications using React, Next.js, Node.js, and PostgreSQL
Integrated OpenAI APIs to add generative AI features like smart property descriptions
Designed backend services with Prisma ORM and REST/GraphQL APIs
Worked with microservice architectures and containerized environments (Docker)
Implemented automated tests and participated in architectural decisions
Used Tailwind and TypeScript across the full stack for maintainability and consistency
Deployed projects to Vercel and Linux-based servers with CI/CD pipelines

workExperience.title: Software Developer
description: Developed custom platforms and MVPs for small businesses and real estate clients
Created full-stack solutions with React, Node.js, MySQL, and Sequelize
Implemented REST APIs and responsive UIs using Tailwind CSS
Used TypeScript across all projects to ensure type safety and reduce bugs
Managed deployments on VPS and cloud servers using Linux and Git
Maintained client communication and handled project scoping and delivery

workExperience.title: Front-End Developer
description: Built SPAs with React and Redux, increasing user retention by 15%
Improved conversion rates by 20% through A/B testing and performance optimization
Created internal UI component libraries, reducing development time by 30%
Developed custom React hooks and reusable components

technologyExperiences.React: Franco has built multiple interactive user interfaces with React, including an e‑commerce platform and a task management app. He leveraged hooks, state management (Redux, Zustand), and performance optimizations to improve load times and responsiveness.
technologyExperiences.Next.js: Franco used Next.js for his portfolio and freelance projects to enable server‑side rendering, static site generation, and seamless routing. He integrated dynamic API routes and optimized the initial load with image and script optimization.
technologyExperiences.TypeScript: Franco applied TypeScript across all frontend and backend layers, reducing runtime errors by around 20% and enhancing code quality and developer experience.
technologyExperiences.Node.js: Franco built RESTful and GraphQL APIs with Node.js and Express, handling database connections, authentication, and business logic for various apps including e‑commerce and collaboration tools.
technologyExperiences.Express: In combination with Node.js, Franco used Express to structure scalable backends, define middleware, and handle routing and error management for production‑ready applications.
technologyExperiences.Python: Franco worked on backend utilities and scripts using Python and FastAPI/Django for specific freelance tasks, including data processing and small web services.
technologyExperiences.FastAPI: Franco used FastAPI to quickly spin up performant REST APIs, benefiting from its built‑in validation, documentation, and async capabilities.
technologyExperiences.Django: Franco built traditional web apps and admin interfaces with Django for internal tools, taking advantage of its ORM, authentication system and rapid scaffolding.
technologyExperiences.PostgreSQL: Franco used PostgreSQL extensively in his task manager and e‑commerce projects to model relational data with Prisma/Sequelize, write optimized SQL queries, and ensure data integrity.
technologyExperiences.MongoDB: Franco used MongoDB with Mongoose in his e‑commerce platform to model product catalogs, orders, and user sessions in a flexible document‑based structure.
technologyExperiences.MySQL: Franco applied MySQL in freelance projects requiring relational databases, creating schemas, relations and integrating with ORMs like Sequelize.
technologyExperiences.Redis: Franco implemented Redis for caching session data and improving performance in high‑traffic apps like task collaboration tools.
technologyExperiences.SQLite: Franco used lightweight SQLite databases for quick prototypes and small utilities where simplified storage was sufficient.
technologyExperiences.GraphQL: Franco built GraphQL APIs using Node.js and Express with Apollo Server, enabling flexible client queries in production apps.
technologyExperiences.Docker: Franco containerized applications end‑to‑end with Docker, defining Dockerfiles and docker‑compose for development and CI setups.
technologyExperiences.Git/GitHub/GitLab: Franco uses Git daily with CI/CD pipelines, code reviews and branching strategies to ensure clean and collaborative development.
technologyExperiences.AWS: Franco deployed apps to AWS, managing CPU/storage with EC2 or Lambda, databases with RDS and S3 for static asset hosting.
technologyExperiences.Vercel/Netlify: Franco used Vercel and Netlify for deploying React/Next.js frontends with serverless functions and instant rollbacks.
technologyExperiences.Jest: Franco wrote unit tests for frontend components and backend endpoints to safeguard functionality and reduce regressions.
technologyExperiences.React Testing Library: Franco utilized RTL for testing UI components, ensuring accessibility compliance and component behavior.
technologyExperiences.Cypress/Playwright: Franco set up end‑to‑end tests with Cypress/Playwright to validate user flows like checkout or drag‑and‑drop.
technologyExperiences.OAuth/NextAuth.js/JWT: Franco implemented secure authentication flows using OAuth providers and JWT sessions in Next.js apps.
technologyExperiences.Tailwind CSS/Sass/Bootstrap: Franco styled UIs using Tailwind, Sass or Bootstrap, focusing on responsive design and consistency across devices.
technologyExperiences.Framer Motion: Franco added polished animations and transitions using Framer Motion to improve UX and polish interfaces.
technologyExperiences.Postman: Franco used Postman to test and document APIs during development and backend integrations.
technologyExperiences.Figma/Adobe XD: Franco created UI/UX mockups and prototypes in Figma and Adobe XD before implementation.
technologyExperiences.SEO: Franco optimized page structure, metadata, and performance to improve search visibility and Lighthouse scores.
technologyExperiences.Accessibility (WCAG): Franco ensured ARIA labels, proper semantic HTML and keyboard navigation to meet WCAG accessibility standards.
technologyExperiences.Supabase: Franco used Supabase extensively in StartOn for backend-as-a-service, leveraging its PostgreSQL database, Edge Functions, real-time subscriptions, and authentication system. This enabled rapid development of complex features like multi-role authorization and private messaging.
technologyExperiences.Google OAuth 2.0: Franco implemented Google OAuth 2.0 authentication in StartOn with advanced JWT handling and automatic refresh tokens, providing seamless user experience and secure access control.
technologyExperiences.SCSS Modules: Franco used SCSS Modules in StartOn for scalable and maintainable styling, creating reusable component styles and implementing a consistent design system across the platform.
technologyExperiences.Lucide React: Franco integrated Lucide React icons in StartOn for a modern, consistent iconography system that enhances user interface clarity and visual appeal.

softSkills: Attention to detail with clean, accessible design
Curious and eager to learn continuously
Open to feedback and continuous improvement

projects.name: StartOn
projects.description: Complete talent-startup connection platform with multi-role dashboards, internal messaging, and advanced networking capabilities
projects.impact: Built a comprehensive platform connecting developers, designers, and tech professionals with innovative startups and companies. Features include differentiated role-based dashboards, Google OAuth authentication, and Supabase backend with Edge Functions.

projects.name: Quiero Sport E-commerce
projects.description: Full e-commerce platform for sports gear with product browsing, cart management, and secure checkout
projects.impact: Delivered a fast, modern UX with secure authentication, reliable data handling (Prisma), and streamlined development (Docker). Features include user authentication (NextAuth.js), order storage (PostgreSQL & Prisma), and deployment on Vercel.

projects.name: Property Recommender
projects.description: Web application that recommends real estate properties based on user preferences and similarity algorithms
projects.impact: Provides targeted recommendations, improving user satisfaction and decision-making efficiency. Includes an admin panel for user property management and favorites tracking.

projects.name: Medicare Healthcare CRM
projects.description: Full-stack web application to manage patients, medications, and treatment assignments in a digital healthcare workflow
projects.impact: Simplifies healthcare treatment management with structured CRUD operations, assignment tracking, and automatic remaining days calculation. Ensures reliability with full-stack validation and high test coverage.

projects.name: Task Manager
projects.description: Comprehensive task management application built with Next.js and PostgreSQL
projects.impact: Provides a reliable solution with user-specific task management, secure data storage, and responsive design that works across all devices.
